<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/301cb0bc17ca76a396dc75e2651dee4d/tumblr_inline_n86cokmE731rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/8aba0dbb6a104ffb9ac017985082b523/tumblr_inline_n86crvZ2Ow1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><strong>arc5555</strong> has been hard at work on the “alpha” version of a major project - papercraft versions of all parts featured in <em>KSP</em>. He’s around a third of the way through right now and we’re pleased to see how well made everything has been so far.</p>

<p>Want to build your own <em>KSP</em> papercraft? <strong>arc5555</strong> has all his files available for <a href="http://bit.ly/1qtQpPE"><strong>DOWNLOAD</strong></a>.</p>
Yep, rep given and recommendations made in other threads already :-)
Someone has to much time on their hands and not enough in KSP flying rockets.
Imagine Konsumable Kerbals, going to bake up some gingerbread, cut and decorate parts, build and well crash inevitably (mostly) into my mouth. Thanks now I can make up the proper Kookie Kutters.
Can we get a demonstration video to accompany this?
Want to make my own working KSP based rocket now, thanks guys....
Well, hey, he might as well start up Kerlington in real life.

Want to make my own working KSP based rocket now, thanks guys....

Lol...that actually sounds awesome. Made me think that a partnership between Squad and ESTES to make KSP-themed model rockets would be a very cool thing
KSP and LEGO seriously need to team up.

KSP and LEGO seriously need to team up.

https://ideas.lego.com/projects/49675

vote here
Here's the Lander I made with the files provided. Doesn't look quite as pretty as I was hoping but I'm still pretty happy with it.
This looks like fun. I might have to decorate my cubicle with some of these. I assume it works with Procedural Fairings?

Agreed, mediafire used to be a great way of hosting, but recently it was infested with full screen ads, and for me it never actually downloads. Will PM arc5555.
